address"}}},"stateVariables":{"adminAddresses":{"details":"Admin addresses can perform privileged operations like pausing/unpausing"},"authorizations":{"details":"This mapping is used to check if a user is authorized to send a message for a specific labelThe mapping is structured as follows:     label -> user addresses     If address(0) is used as the user address, it indicates permissionless access"},"authorizationsData":{"details":"This mapping stores the authorization data for each label     Key: label, Value: array of AuthorizationData"},"callbacks":{"details":"This mapping stores the execution"},"verificationGateway":{"details":"If zero-knowledge proofs are not being used, this can be set to address(0)"},"zkAuthorizationLastExecutionBlock":{"details":"This mapping is used to prevent replay attacks by ensuring that proofs that are older or the same than the last executed one cannot be usedThis is important to ensure that the same or a previous proof cannot be usedThe mapping is structured as follows:     registry ID -> last block number of the proof executed"},"zkAuthorizations":{"details":"This mapping is used to check if a user is authorized to send a message for"},"zkAuthorizations(uint64,uint256)":{"notice":"Mapping of what addresses are authorized to send messages for a specific registry ID"}},"notice":"The Authorization contract acts as a middleware for managing access control to the Processor contract. It controls which addresses can call specific functions on specific contracts in a specific order through the processor. It will receive callbacks from the processor after executing messages and can either store the callback data in its state or just emit events for addAdminAddress(address).details: Can only be called by the owner

params._admin: Address to be granted admin privileges

addRegistries(uint64[],address[][],bytes.details: This function allows the owner to add multiple registries and their associated users and verification keys

params.registries: Array of registry IDs to be added
params.users: Array of arrays of user addresses associated with each registry
params.validateBlockNumber: Array of booleans indicating if we need to validate the last block execution for each registry
params.vks: Array of verification keys associated with each registry

addStandardAuthorizations(string[],addre.details: Can only be called by the owner

params._authorizationData: Array of arrays of authorization data associated with each label
params._labels: Array of labels for the authorizations
params._users: Array of arrays of user addresses associated with each label

constructor.details: Initializes the contract with owner, processor, and optional verifier

params._owner: Address that will be set as the owner of this contract
params._processor: Address of the processor contract that will execute messages
params._storeCallbacks: Boolean indicating whether to store callbacks or just emitting events
params._verificationGateway: Address of the ZK verification gateway contract (can be address(0) if not using ZK proofs)

executeZKMessage(bytes,bytes).details: This function verifies the proof and executes the message if authorizedThe proof is verified using the verification gateway before executing the message

params._message: Encoded ZK message to be executed
params._proof: Proof associated with the ZK message

getZkAuthorizationsList(uint64).details: This function returns all addresses that are authorized to send messages for the given registry IDIt's useful for checking which addresses have permission to send messages in one go

returns._0: An array of all authorized addresses for the given registry ID

handleCallback(bytes).details: This function is called by the processor to notify the contract of execution results

params.callbackData: Encoded callback data containing execution result and other information

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

removeAdminAddress(address).details: Can only be called by the owner

params._admin: Address to have admin privileges revoked

removeRegistries(uint64[]).details: This function allows the owner to remove a registry and its associated users

params.registries: Array of registry IDs to be removed

removeStandardAuthorizations(string[]).details: Can only be called by the owner

params._labels: Array of labels for the authorizations to be removed

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

sendProcessorMessage(string,bytes).details: This function is called by authorized addresses to send messages to the processor

params._message: The encoded message to be sent to the processor
params.label: The label of the authorization that is being used

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

updateProcessor(address).details: Can only be called by the owner

updateVerificationGateway(address).details: Can only be called by the owner

addAdminAddress(address).notice: Adds an address to the list of admin addresses

addRegistries(uint64[],address[][],bytes.notice: Adds a new registry with its associated users and verification keys

addStandardAuthorizations(string[],addre.notice: Adds standard authorizations for a specific label

adminAddresses(address).notice: Mapping of addresses that are allowed to perform admin operations

authorizations(string,uint256).notice: Mapping of authorization labels to their associated addresses that can execute them

authorizationsData(string,uint256).notice: Mapping of authorization labels to their associated data

callbacks(uint64).notice: Mapping of execution IDs to callback data

constructor.notice: Sets up the Authorization contract with initial configuration

executeZKMessage(bytes,bytes).notice: Executes a ZK message with proof verification

executionId().notice: Current execution ID for tracking message execution

getZkAuthorizationsList(uint64).notice: Get all authorized addresses for a specific registry ID

handleCallback(bytes).notice: Handles callbacks from the processor after executing messages

removeAdminAddress(address).notice: Removes an address from the list of admin addresses

removeRegistries(uint64[]).notice: Removes a registry and its associated users

removeStandardAuthorizations(string[]).notice: Removes standard authorizations for a specific set of labels

sendProcessorMessage(string,bytes).notice: Sends a message to the processor for execution

storeCallbacks().notice: Boolean indicating whether to store callbacks or just emit events for them

updateVerificationGateway(address).notice: Updates the ZK verification gateway contract address

validateBlockNumberExecution(uint64).notice: Mapping of registry ID to boolean indicating if we need to validate the last block execution

verificationGateway().notice: Address of the verification gateway contract used for zero-knowledge proof verification

zkAuthorizationLastExecutionBlock(uint64.notice: Mapping of the last block a proof was executed for

zkAuthorizations(uint64,uint256).notice: Mapping of what addresses are authorized to send messages for a specific registry ID
